data.title: AI use their harvester attack player base once give them weapon.
data.body: I put the gun to Harvester it appear AI send them along with their army to attack my base and stop their harvesting activity entirely.

data.title: Speed up shroud visibility updates.
data.body:
A unit with the CreatesShroud or RevealsShroud trait must update all shrouds when it changes position. Calculating the tiles it can currently see is an expensive calculation that previously had to be repeated for every shroud that needed to know these tiles.

Now, we lazily populate a ref parameter to allow it to be reused for an actor if possible. The biggest improvement comes from the fact that allied players can re-use this calculation when updating their shrouds. Since many games includes a neutral player allied to both sides, most games will see a decent speedup.

On the RA shellmap, shroud updates dropped from 2.80% of total CPU time to 1.50% (because of the neutral player). Games with large teams will see an even more significant improvement.

data.title: Added audio.bag/audio.idx support used in RA2
data.body:
This patch will introduce two new classes for reading Westwood's sound effect files for Red Alert 2.

It does not modify the existing WavLoader and provides a regular Stream for it to handle as if it was directly reading a file.

data.title: Moved the Grenadier to the Allies
data.body:
Reasoning:
- Soviets already got a fast infantry scout (dog).
- Soviets already got a strong unit against buildings (flame thrower). #7503
- Allies lacked a suitable infantry unit to drop into an undefended base.
- They seem to fit better with the Allies theme as they work somehow similar to artillery (explosions, chain reaction) while the flame thrower fit better with V2 (splash damage, fire).
- The soviets already have a lot of (redundant) infantry actors.

data.title: Refactored MobileInfo, Mobile and Move
data.body:
Refactored MobileInfo, Mobile and Move to make them testable in isolation, easier to understand what they do by commenting and restructuring the code making sure to not cause undesired side-effects.

The fact of having to break dependencies on a highly coupled system forced me to modify and create several interfaces, that at the same time forced me to change several classes directly and indirectly related to Move, Mobile and MobileInfo.

Additionally, I added several unit tests to try how testable they've become.

I've been comenting throughoutfully the code, I've been manipulating, yet to sum up:
- By no means this refactor is complete. It should be completed through the span of several PR. If you take a look at the MoveTests, you'll see that I had to mock a load of dependencies in order to make the tests pass successfully. This is a clear smell of Demeter violation. The construction of Move instances should be delegated to some kind of Move factory that can resolve all the move dependencies for him. This, utimately, will make Move easier to undertand.
- There is no clear barrier and meaning between Mobile and MobileInfo. There are lot of functions that Mobile could deal by himself and yet are delegated to MobileInfo...
- The crush, block, enterCell, finishmove notifications... are implemented in a way that couples actors to each other. We should think in a way to make this work on a subscribe/publish like the Observer Pattern: http://dotnetcodr.com/2013/08/01/design-patterns-and-practices-in-net-the-observer-pattern/ . A message bus implementation of this would be really smart for the future, and would skyroof the performance.

data.title: Speed up map border shroud & fix viewport visible cells
data.body:
This PR is technically two in one (and I can split it if required) but there is a minor dependency between the commits and they're fairly small so I'm hoping nobody will mind too much :)
#### Speed up map shroud border

When rendering the shroud that only affects the map border (for example, on the RA shellmap, when "disable shroud" is chosen during observing or when the "disable fog and shroud" cheat is active) we can skip the render entirely if the map border isn't even visible onscreen. This buys a surprising amount of performance as looping over all the visible cells to render nothing is still pretty expensive. On the RA shellmap total CPU time spent rendering the shroud drops from 3.75% to 0.05% (the border is never visible here so we can always bail early).

To test this, just make sure the shroud continues to display correctly at the map border when using one of the modes described above.
#### Fix visible cells calculation

Viewport.VisibleCells was actually returning a larger region than it needed to. This is a correctness issue, as well as a small perf hit since cells that are offscreen are being rendered.

I reworked the calculation to something that I hope covers the minimal area.

To test this, make sure that when panning both a rectangular and isometric map that you can always see cells at the edge of the screen.

If you specifically want to test that the new calculation covers a smaller, more correct area, try the following:
Insert a line in Viewport.cs at line 181 (or thereabouts) so it looks like this.

``` csharp
cells = new CellRegion(map.TileShape, tl, br);
cells = CellRegion.Expand(cells, -1); // Extra line. This will leave a 1 cell gap between the edge of the screen and the render area.
cellsDirty = false;
```

In this PR, you should notice a one cell gap around the edge of the map (try using the "disabled shroud & fog" and "show terrain geometry" options to help).

On bleed, you will notice it still renders more than it needs, particularly on the right and bottom of the screen. Try upping the value from -1 to -3 or something like that to see what it is really doing.

This also applies to isometric maps, except for the bottom of the screen. Due to the tile height it renders downwards a bit more than usual to account for the heights. This is normal (I believe).

data.title: Speed up frozen actor updates & prevent flicker
data.body:
Fixes  #7660.

Previously frozen actor updates were done twice per actor. The FrozenUnderFog tick would do this as well as the FrozenActorLayer doing it for every FrozenActor to see if the frozen actor was still visible under the current shroud conditions.

Calculating whether the actor was visible under the shroud is expensive, so we avoid doing it twice since there's no need. Now FrozenUnderFog will update everything as needed.

A couple of further commits introduce some related refactorings and cleanup.

This PR is purely optimization, the behaviour of frozen actors should remain 100% if you're testing this :)

On the RA shellmap, this reduces total CPU time spent doing the frozen actor updates from 6.21% to 4.13%.

data.title: Added Campaign for CnC-mod
data.body:
Hello,
as part of a student project we worked on OpenRA (the same project as the mission-teams)
Our team implemented a campaign menu for the CnC:TD mod.
It features:
    - a new entry in the singleplayer menu
    - Faction selection
        -- the nostalgic transmission selection for new games
        -- continue with the campaign of GDI or Nod
    - playing missions of one faction in chronological order
    - a selection if there are alternative missions (i.e. a-,b-,c-missions)
        -- if multiple path exist an overview-map with all paths is shown (image is taken out of the a-mission-folder)
    - country information, if specified in the mission yaml (optional)
    - saving progress after each successful mission
        -- nod and gdi progress is tracked independently
    - a congratulation-message after the last available mission was won

ToDos:
- [x] make variables readonly if possible
- [x] fix incorrect namespacing
- [x] add a continue button after sucessful mission
- [x] skip to faction-selection if no saves exist
- [x] use "var" where possible
- [x] make fields "const" where possible
- [x] better support for branching in campaigns
- [x] split and move code from CampaignWorldLogic's constructor
- [x] keep the codechanges inside OpenRA.Mods.Cnc or OpenRA.Mods.Common
- [ ] use MapCache instead of manual preview
- [ ] implement SaveProcessFlag
- [ ] use Lua API for setting/querying campaign status
- [ ] Generalisation for use in other mods (low priority)

data.title: Add inheritance support to weapons
data.body:
Currently only actors can inherit, while weapons have to be fully duplicated even if you need only a single change.

This would probably allow to shrink the number of yaml lines for weapons quite a bit.

data.title: allowed resources to be grown under Actors
data.body: Fixes #7008, by modifying the Gem and Ore resource being allowed to grow under Actors. If this has some unexpected side effects please let me know

data.title: Adds a debug symbol (RA mod)
data.body: This PR changes the debug symbol (it currently uses the Options one) to its own new symbol.

data.title: Selling Barracks in Mission3a crashes game
data.body:
**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Play Allied Mission 3a.
2. Capture the Soviet Barracks in the first Soviet base.
3. Sell it.

**What I expected:**

The Barracks is sold and the game continues.

**What happens:**

The game crashes with a fatal map script error.

**Relevant log: lua.log**

```
  Fatal Lua Error: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
     at OpenRA.Scripting.ScriptContext.FatalError(System.String message)
     at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Scripting.TriggerGlobal+<OnAllRemovedFromWorld>c__AnonStorey3.<>m__0(OpenRA.Actor m)
     at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Scripting.ScriptTriggers.RemovedFromWorld(OpenRA.Actor self)
     at OpenRA.World.Remove(OpenRA.Actor a)
     at OpenRA.Actor.<Destroy>m__5(OpenRA.World w)
     at OpenRA.World.Tick()
     at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager)
     at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick()
     at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
     at OpenRA.Game.Run()
     at OpenRA.Program.Run(System.String[] args)
     at OpenRA.Program.Main(System.String[] args)
```

data.title: Move away from mod-specific engine code (part 86): Countries and Races
data.body:
As I've mentioned a couple of times before, the `Country` and `Race` are really out-of-place in the engine. They might have been OK once (years ago), but not any more.
You have `Country` and `Race` in the code and in YAML, but the players see factions, countries, alliances of countries, Great Houses, etc.
Currently we have:
- Tiberian Dawn: GDI vs Nod (government vs terrorists, or faction vs faction)
- Red Alert: Russia vs USA (country vs country), more popular as USSR vs The Allied Nations (faction vs faction)
- Dune 2000: Atreides vs Harkonnen vs Ordos (houses) vs Corrino/Emperror (house/faction/government) vs Fremen vs Smugglers vs Mercenaries (factions)

We'll be having also:
- Tiberian Sun: GDI vs Nod (government vs terrorists, or faction vs faction) (include the Scrin to get a `species`)
- Firestorm: GDI vs Nod (government vs terrorists, or faction vs faction)
- Red Alert 2: Russia vs USA (country vs country)
- Yuri's revenge: Russia vs USA vs Yuri (country vs country vs faction)

Hopefully one day:
- Generals: USA vs China vs GLA (country vs country vs terrorist faction)
- Zero Hour: USA vs China vs GLA vs Gen1 vs ... (country vs country vs terrorist faction vs rogue faction 1 vs rogue faction 2 vs ...)

Unofficial mods may include:
- Civilizations
- Empires
- Kingdoms
- Tribes
- Races
- Species

The engine code should be generic enough for all official mods (and as much as possible for any unofficial).
So I am proposing (again) to switch any mentions of `Country`, `Race`, `House`, `Species`, etc. in the code with the generic enough `Faction`.

My earlier statement can be found [here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7399#issuecomment-74166608).

data.title: Replace Rank and Tags and make more use of WithDecoration
data.body:
Basically what @Phrohdoh tried to do for #7466 (as discussed on IRC).
This can be extended and be used for:
- [x] The spy insignia (#7466)
- [ ] Unit stance decoration (#3437)
- [x] Unit rank (#8300)
- [ ] Adding a faction logo to MCVs (since most games use the same MCVs for all factions, a logo to distinguish what MCV is the one you are looking at might be nice). Same for ConYards.
- [x] "Unit waiting for carryall", as seen in the original Dune 2000
- [ ] Sum of all `IDamageModifier`s (shield if < 100% damage, for instance)
- [x] Primary Building indicator
- [ ] "Hero unit" decoration (be it a star, like Mental Omega, or a skull like Tiberium wars), again mentioned in #7466
- [x] Fake building indicator

data.title: Can't install assets from a TFD disk.
data.body: This should probably be a low priority since since you can download a disk image online and make a cd, but I figure this convenience would be nice since my only readable disk at this point is a TFD one.

data.title: TD: Light Tanks vs Medium Tanks. Tanks vs Bikes.
data.body:
Light Tanks vs Medium Tanks:

This is a very hard one for me. This is a double edge sword. The Light Tanks can seemingly out perform the medium tanks with numbers of say 10 vs 7. Which I figured the Mediums would win. However if the mediums are evenly numbered or close the mediums win.

The problem could be that the light tanks perhaps shoot a tad bit to fast? But then this could create issues vs other units (Such as Nod vs Nod or other GDI units.) So im not entirely sure how to make a work around on this. Maybe a slight medium tank HP increase? Turrets turn rate is a bit faster? What do you guys think?

---

As for the bikes, I think when the fix comes through and are able to implement the build speed modifiers from the price the price rate can stay at 600. But perhaps the bikes range is to far vs tanks? Its got a 2 ranger advantage then the tanks itself. Perhaps knocked to a 1 range different?
